portfolio.title: Image Processing API with Google Drive Integration
portfolio.description: Developed a robust Node.js/Express API service that processes images with dynamic border customization. The API accepts base64-encoded images and allows users to specify border size (0-50px) and color. Built using Sharp for high-performance image processing, the service optimizes output quality using MozJPEG compression while maintaining image fidelity. Features secure Google Drive integration for persistent storage, automatically uploading processed images and returning shareable links. The application is deployed using GitHub Actions for CI/CD, implementing secure credential management and automated deployment to a Linux server. Built with scalability in mind, the API includes CORS support for cross-origin requests and comprehensive error handling. Technologies used: Node.js, Express, Sharp, Google Drive API, GitHub Actions, PM2 for process management, and secure credential handling for production deployment.

portfolio.title: Finsweet Marquee

Perfect for showcasing logos, announcements, or dynamic visuals, the marquee requires no coding knowledge and offers customizable options like speed and direction for a polished, professional scrolling effect.

portfolio.title: Better Off

portfolio.title: Xano API & React
portfolio.description:
I was researching on how best to create APIs with Xano for a wized project i was undertaking.
I thought of my react portofolio which had hardcoded blog elements. I thought why not use a Xano API instead for my react portfolio.
So utilising useEffect and useState combo so that onComponent mount, this page fires a get request to a xano endpoint and xano returns an ordered list of projects in json which i use Array.map()
to produce a dynamic list of elements. Infact this page your reading now gets json data from a xano database!

portfolio.title: CI/CD Pipeline
portfolio.description:
I got bored deploying react code on vercel. Coming from a linux backgroud, I wrote my CI-CD Workflow that emulates vercel in my VM to automate code deployment using github actions. I setup a Github Hosted runner and wrote a custom YAML File to enable the runner build, test,Â 
automatically deploy the app on my RHEL VM. I was able to setup custom users and passwordless SSH Keys that enable runners to automatically SSH into, CD into my deployment directory and deploy my react portfolio. All i have to do is push my JS changes
incrementally and my workflow will test and deploy my portfolio to my custom domain on an EC2 Instance. I wrote a whole blog on how JS Devs can use github actions, runners, workflows and linux to automate deployments
